state.goal: Build a feature rich react UI that uses websockets to allow a user to visualise what is happening when the agents are running. Make it a comprehensive UI. Do not change the existing terminal display, that is fine, in the terminal just mention the http port the user can browse to for more.

plan.goal: Build a feature rich react UI that uses websockets to allow a user to visualise what is happening when the agents are running. Make it a comprehensive UI. Do not change the existing terminal display, that is fine, in the terminal just mention the http port the user can browse to for more.
plan.analysis: This task requires building a comprehensive React UI with WebSocket integration to visualize agent execution in real-time, alongside the existing CLI tool. This involves backend WebSocket server setup, React frontend with multiple visualization components, and integration with the existing agent runner.

steps.description: Create WebSocket server module that integrates with the existing agent runner to broadcast real-time events (agent status, step progress, logs, metrics)
Build React frontend scaffolding with Vite, establish WebSocket client connection, and create the main dashboard layout with navigation
Implement agent status panel component showing current running agents, their states, and high-level progress indicators
Build step execution timeline/visualization component that shows the DAG of steps, their dependencies, and execution status in real-time
Create live log viewer component with filtering, search, and auto-scroll functionality for agent outputs and system messages
Implement metrics and statistics dashboard showing execution time, success/failure rates, retry counts, and resource usage
Add step detail view component showing individual step information, outputs, errors, and retry history when selected
Build goal progress visualization showing overall goal achievement status, confidence levels, and iteration tracking
Integrate WebSocket server startup into the main CLI entry point and add HTTP server to serve the React UI, displaying the URL in terminal
Add UI polish: loading states, error handling, responsive design, dark/light theme, and toast notifications for important events

plan.raw:
ANALYSIS: This task requires building a comprehensive React UI with WebSocket integration to visualize agent execution in real-time, alongside the existing CLI tool. This involves backend WebSocket server setup, React frontend with multiple visualization components, and integration with the existing agent runner.

PLAN:
1. Create WebSocket server module that integrates with the existing agent runner to broadcast real-time events (agent status, step progress, logs, metrics) | medium
2. Build React frontend scaffolding with Vite, establish WebSocket client connection, and create the main dashboard layout with navigation | medium
3. Implement agent status panel component showing current running agents, their states, and high-level progress indicators | medium
4. Build step execution timeline/visualization component that shows the DAG of steps, their dependencies, and execution status in real-time | complex
5. Create live log viewer component with filtering, search, and auto-scroll functionality for agent outputs and system messages | medium
6. Implement metrics and statistics dashboard showing execution time, success/failure rates, retry counts, and resource usage | medium
7. Add step detail view component showing individual step information, outputs, errors, and retry history when selected | medium
8. Build goal progress visualization showing overall goal achievement status, confidence levels, and iteration tracking | medium
9. Integrate WebSocket server startup into the main CLI entry point and add HTTP server to serve the React UI, displaying the URL in terminal | medium
10. Add UI polish: loading states, error handling, responsive design, dark/light theme, and toast notifications for important events | medium

TOTAL_STEPS: 10
